LAB2

Class Keyboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • LAB2.Keyboard

  • public class Keyboard
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as a main keyboard that holds code and value of all the buttons as a String data type. Also, provides the methods to get and manipulate the class variables.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Keyboard(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> buttonCodeList, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> buttonValueList)
      Takes the codes and values of the buttons required to be in the keyboard and add the general buttons with their codes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToDisplayedText(java.lang.String newdisplayedText)
      Adds a new text to the existing one (displayedText)
      void backspace()
      Deletes one character at the end of the displayedText.
      void buttonPressed(java.lang.String buttoncode)
      This method calls the getButtonCodeIndex and passes the buttoncode.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllButtonsCode() 
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllButtonsValue() 
      int getButtonCodeIndex(java.lang.String buttoncode)
      Takes the button code and looks for the index of that button in both stored arrays (buttonCodeList and buttonValueList).
      java.lang.String getDisplayedText() 
      void newLine()
      Jumps to a new line in the displayedText.
      void space()
      Adds a space character at the end of the displayedText.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Keyboard

        public Keyboard(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> buttonCodeList,
                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> buttonValueList)
        Takes the codes and values of the buttons required to be in the keyboard and add the general buttons with their codes.
        Parameters:
        buttonCodeList - A list of the required buttons code
        buttonValueList - A list of the required buttons value

    • Method Detail

      • getButtonCodeIndex

        public int getButtonCodeIndex(java.lang.String buttoncode)
        Takes the button code and looks for the index of that button in both stored arrays (buttonCodeList and buttonValueList).
        Parameters:
        buttoncode - The code of button which the user is looking for its value.
        Returns:
        The index of the button in the buttonCodeList and buttonValueList arrays.

      • buttonPressed

        public void buttonPressed(java.lang.String buttoncode)
        This method calls the getButtonCodeIndex and passes the buttoncode. Then if the code is not found, the method returns without output. Otherwise, the method checks if the code for one of the general buttons. If the button pressed is not a general button, then the value of that button is added to the displayedText.
        Parameters:
        buttoncode - the code of the pressed button.

      • backspace

        public void backspace()
        Deletes one character at the end of the displayedText.

      • space

        public void space()
        Adds a space character at the end of the displayedText.

      • newLine

        public void newLine()
        Jumps to a new line in the displayedText.

      • getAllButtonsValue

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllButtonsValue()
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of strings of buttons value (buttonValueList)

      • getAllButtonsCode

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllButtonsCode()
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of strings of buttons code (buttonCodeList)

      • getDisplayedText

        public java.lang.String getDisplayedText()
        Returns:
        the string variable that stored the entered values (displayedText)

      • addToDisplayedText

        public void addToDisplayedText(java.lang.String newdisplayedText)
        Adds a new text to the existing one (displayedText)
        Parameters:
        newdisplayedText - the new text.
